name: hermes
description: A simple web project build system. Hermes takes care of little things so you don't have to; he runs messages to other apps to take care of things like linting, concatenation, and minification. Inspired by Keith Cirkel's http://blog.keithcirkel.co.uk/how-to-use-npm-as-a-build-tool

scripts.init:
echo '


Initializing...' && parallelshell 'npm run browser-sync' 'npm run sass' 'npm run watch-cat-js'
scripts.init-nocat:
echo '


Initializing...' && parallelshell 'npm run browser-sync' 'npm run sass'
scripts.browser-sync: browser-sync start --proxy localhost:8080/~michael/$npm_package_config_webdir --files='*.html, css/*.css, js/*.js, js/*.json, img/*.png, img/*.jpg, img/*.gif, svg/*.svg'
scripts.premakedist:
npm run lint-css && read -p '
Press [Enter] key to continue to js linting...' && npm run lint-js && read -p '
Press [Enter] key to continue to dist build...'
scripts.makedist: npm run cp-html && npm run makedist-sass && npm run cat-js && npm run uglify-js && npm run dist-browser-sync
scripts.dist-browser-sync: browser-sync start --proxy localhost:8080/~michael/$npm_package_config_webdir/dist --files='*.html, css/*.css, js/*.js, js/*.json, img/*.png, img/*.jpg, img/*.gif, svg/*.svg'
